      • rotate

        @JvmStatic
 @NotNull
public static Tessellator rotate(float angle,
                                                      float x,
                                                      float y,
                                                      float z)

        Rotates the Tessellator in 3d space. Similar to {@link com.chattriggers.ctjs.minecraft.libs.renderer.Renderer#rotate(float)}

        Parameters:
        angle - the angle to rotate
        x - if the rotation is around the x axis
        y - if the rotation is around the y axis
        z - if the rotation is around the z axis
        Returns:
        the Tessellator to allow for method chaining

      • tex

        @JvmStatic
 @NotNull
public static Tessellator tex(float u,
                                                   float v)

        Sets the texture location on the last defined vertex. Use directly after using Tessellator.pos

        Parameters:
        u - the u position in the texture
        v - the v position in the texture
        Returns:
        the Tessellator to allow for method chaining
        See Also:
        Tessellator.pos

      • drawString

        @JvmStatic
 @JvmOverloads
public static void drawString(@NotNull
                                                        java.lang.String text,
                                                        float x,
                                                        float y,
                                                        float z,
                                                        int color,
                                                        boolean renderBlackBox,
                                                        float scale,
                                                        boolean increase)

        Renders floating lines of text in the 3D world at a specific position.

        Parameters:
        text - The string array of text to render
        x - X coordinate in the game world
        y - Y coordinate in the game world
        z - Z coordinate in the game world
        color - the color of the text
        renderBlackBox - render a pretty black border behind the text
        scale - the scale of the text
        increase - whether or not to scale the text up as the player moves away
